1.text: The song of songs which is to Solomon.

2.text: He shall kiss me from the kisses of his mouth: for thy good breasts are above wine.

3.text: To the odor of the good ointments thy name shall be poured forth an ointment; for this, the maidens loved thee.

4.text: Draw me, we will run after thee: the king brought me to his chambers: we will exult and rejoice in thee, we will remember thy breasts above wine: the upright loved thee.

5.text: I am black and beautiful, O daughters of Jerusalem, as the tents of Kedar, as the curtains of Solomon.

6.text: Thou shalt not see me, I am black; the sun searched me: my mother’s sons were angry with me; they set me to watch the vineyards; my vineyard I watched not for me.

7.text: Announce to me, thou whom my soul loved, where thou wilt feed, where thou wilt lie down at noon: wherefore shall I be as he covered by the herds of thy companions.

8.text: If thou shalt not know for thyself, O fair one among women, come forth for thyself at the heels of the flock, and feed thy kids by the shepherds tents.

9.text: To my mares in Pharaoh’s chariots I likened thee, O my neighbor.

10.text: Thy cheeks were beautiful with with rows, thy neck with strings of pearls.

11.text: We will make for thee rows of gold, with marks of silver.

12.text: The king yet in his divan, my spikenard gave its odor.

13.text: A bundle of myrrh my beloved to me; he shall lodge between my breasts.

14.text: A cluster of cypress my beloved to me in the vineyards of the kids fountain.

15.text: Behold thee fair, my friend; behold thee beautiful; thine eyes are doves’.

16.text: Behold thee beautiful, my beloved, also pleasant: also our bed is green.

17.text: The walls of our houses cedars, our carved ceilings, cypresses.
